Many a small thing has been made large by the right kind of advertising. And so is the reverse. 
 
You 
 
got to do what it takes to sell. This event gives you not just a chance to create advertisements 
 
but to 
 
act it out. You are the ‘Ad-Guru’ and the Brand Ambassador. Slice is selling on its ‘Ras ki Holi’ 
 
while 
 
Idea has got the entire nation humming ‘You’re My Honey-bunny!’. What will your product sell 
 
for? 
 
Show us! 
 
Rules and Regulations: 
 
General ~ 
 
Each team can consist of a maximum of 3 members. 
 
Once a product (on which the ad is supposed to be made) is given, no team shall ask/request 
 
for an alternative. 
 
Improvisation is allowed, but the advertised product must remain the same as specified. 
 
The advertisement can be in any language or even multi-lingual. 
 
Any team making use of illicit/vulgar language will be disqualified. 
 
Prelims ~ 
 
Random topics (names of products to be endorsed) will be given on spot. 
 
Each team will get a maximum of 5 minutes to prepare their act. 
 
Time limit for the presentation of each act is 1 and a half minutes. 
 
Finals ~ 
 
There will be one common topic for every finalist team, given well in advance. 
 
The time limit for each act is 2 minutes. 
 
The teams are allowed to use props in the finals. However, they should make all 
 
arrangements of the prop and Avenir will not provide them with any requisites. 
 
Judging Parameters: 
 
Effective Utilization of Time. 
 
Communication skills-Do others understand it? 
 
Creativity-Is there anything original, different and unique about the act? 
 
Marketing skills-Is the act convincing enough for us to want to buy it?
